definition: Yuan dynasty theater, including poetry, music and comedy
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
variant of 麴|曲[qu1]
yeast/Aspergillus (includes many common molds)/Taiwan pr. [qu2]
surname Qu
bent/crooked/wrong
tune/song/CL:支[zhi1]
Four Great Yuan Dramatists, namely: Guan Hanqing 關漢卿|关汉卿[Guan1 Han4 qing1], Zheng Guangzu 鄭光祖|郑光祖[Zheng4 Guang1 zu3], Ma Zhiyuan 馬致遠|马致远[Ma3 Zhi4 yuan3] and Bai Pu 白樸|白朴[Bai2 Pu3]

sentences.english: However, due to some reasons, it has not gained deserved attention.
sentences.chinese: 然而由于种种原因，元曲的介绍并未得到应有的关注。

sentences.english: The main literary achievement in the Yuan Dynasty was Yuan drama.
sentences.chinese: 元朝文学的主要成就是元曲。

sentences.english: Why we say "the most natural for the Chinese Yuan Dynasty Literature"?
sentences.chinese: 为什么说“元曲为中国最自然之文学”？

sentences.english: It resembles Chanda of Song Dynasty and operas of Yuan Dynasty in structure.
sentences.chinese: 其曲体结构与宋代的缠达和元曲的结构也有相似之处。

sentences.english: Great literature, ancient and modern, have used a natural win, while the Mo in the Yuan Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 古今之大文学，无不以自然胜，而莫著于元曲。

definition: Wang Shifu (fl. 1295-1307), author of Romance of the West Chamber 西廂記|西厢记
a Yuan dynasty form of musical comedy
verse or song form from Yuan, Ming and Qing

Chu Ci, the Songs of Chu (ancient book of poems, collected during Han but esp. from country of Chu c. 500 BC)
yuefu (Chinese style of lyric poetry)

Romance of the West Chamber by Wang Shifu 王實甫|王实甫[Wang2 Shi2 fu3]
form of writing novels that comprise lots of poetry in the body of the text, popular in the Ming Dynasty
Collection of Yuefu Songs and Ballads, compiled in the 11th century by Guo Maoqian 郭茂倩[Guo1 Mao4 qian4]
Shijing, the Book of Songs, early collection of Chinese poems and one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1]
